habitat_description: The Mohave Ground Squirrel (Xerospermophilus mohavensis; formerly Spermophilus mohavensis) is a rare species found only in parts of southern California.  It inhabits a wide variety of communities in the western Mojave Desert, including Mojave creosote bush scrub, Mojave mixed woody scrub, blackbrush scrub, Mojave desert wash scrub, Joshua-tree woodland, and shadescale scrub, but prefers Mojave creosote bush scrub (USFWS 2011).  It likes relatively flat areas with fine to medium textured soils (sand or gravel), few rocks, native shrubs, and herbaceous vegetation and avoids dry lakebeds, lava flows, and steep rocky slopes (USFWS 2011, NatureServe 2015).  The species generally occupies areas under 1,706 m but individuals have been found at higher elevations (USFWS 2011).  N. Tarr, 9 January 2015.
